headline.main: The International Situation; On the Battle Fronts

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 5--The framework of the Nazi organization in Uruguay indicates that the German leaders are working carefully and efficiently on an international plan that looks toward the eventual invasion and occupation of this country...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 5--The framework of the Nazi organization in Uruguay indicates that the German leaders are working carefully and efficiently on an international plan that looks toward the eventual invasion and occupation of this country with the help of Nazi groups in Argentina and Brazil.

headline.main: Nazi Plan to Seize Uruguay Indicated; Party Cells Are Operating at Key Points; NAZI PLOT TO TAKE URUGUAY OUTLINED

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan, 6--Trade treaty negotiations with Uruguay will be ended as soon as official announcements to the effect can be prepared in Montevideo and Washington.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan, 6--Trade treaty negotiations with Uruguay will be ended as soon as official announcements to the effect can be prepared in Montevideo and Washington.

headline.main: WASHINGTON TO END URUGUAY PARLEYS; Refusal to Make Concessions in Trade Harmful to Our Producers Is Held Reason

byline.original: By FRANK L. KLUCKHOHN Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Do we really need to spend the proposed colossal sum of $2,330,000,000 for national defense this year? What nations do we have to prepare against and where shall we have to fight them?
docs.lead_paragraph: Do we really need to spend the proposed colossal sum of $2,330,000,000 for national defense this year? What nations do we have to prepare against and where shall we have to fight them?

headline.main: COL. PALMER TELLS OUR DEFENSE NEEDS; Reviews Factors in Light of the Call for Year's Outlay of $2,330,000,000 PHILIPPINES BIG QUESTION Navy's Problem Is Viewed as Not Hard if We Would Not Protect Them After '46

byline.original: By Col. FREDERICK PALMER, Noted Military Expert North American Newspaper Alliance, Inc

docs.snippet: MOSCOW, Jan. 6--The theory is advanced by the Soviet Army organ Red Star today that offers of assistance to Finland, especially by Great Britain and France, are "camouflage for dragging the Scandinavian countries into the war" on the Allies' side.
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Jan. 6--The theory is advanced by the Soviet Army organ Red Star today that offers of assistance to Finland, especially by Great Britain and France, are "camouflage for dragging the Scandinavian countries into the war" on the Allies' side.

headline.main: Soviet Scores Allied Aid to Finns As Ruse to Embroil Scandinavia; Army Organ Backs Reich in Denouncing Help as 'Camouflage' to End Neutrality --Nations Deny Deal for Pacts

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8--The political atmosphere in Congress had recently grown too bad to nourish a trade agreement between the United States and Argentina, and this is why the negotiations between the two countries were suddenly abandoned.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8--The political atmosphere in Congress had recently grown too bad to nourish a trade agreement between the United States and Argentina, and this is why the negotiations between the two countries were suddenly abandoned.
